column2: Lightingbug , 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My gyn told me to use this for 3 weeks before trying intercourse again. This really worked. I've had NO side effects, if anything, it has increased my libido. I'm using it until she says I can't. I'm sorry that others have not had the success that I have had.

column1: Painful Sexual Intercourse due to Menopause
column2: purplegrrl, 55-64 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My doctor never discussed side effects --just told me "how many marriages it's saved." It's expensive -- it  made me feel bloated, with a heavy feeling after taking it -- I didn't notice that much of an effect when I reduced my dose after the first couple of weeks.  Research indicates  a connection with gall bladder disease even after short-term use -- I ended up in the ER with a spastic, inflamed gall bladder (not gallstones) 2 months after starting this product. Who's to say but I wouldn't be surprised if they were related. No GB symptoms since I stopped taking it and I feel so much better now.  I knew from the beginning it didn't agree with me -- wish I'd listened to my body! DHEA, black cohosh, vitex, drinking lots of water and using good old lubricant (Silk is a good brand) are working much better for me. Proceed with caution!

column1: Painful Sexual Intercourse due to Menopause
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I noticed relief from vaginal dryness right away. The first week I had some headaches and mood changes but that went away. I do experience dizziness and some lightheadedness. I will consult my doctor for that. I use the minimum dosage 1-2x a week.

column1: Painful Sexual Intercourse due to Menopause
column2: InTheDesert, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This med changed so many things for me within the first two weeks I was so amazed. Why didn't someone tell me? If only my doctor had said something. I went for my yearly exam and told my OBGYN how painful sex was for me and I was of course Post Menopausal. Wow did I get an education. I only regret not knowing all these years and having to think sex was going to be painful for me and was resigned to that. Thanks to this medication I am no longer miserable and back to the old me. I feel normal now.

column9: Initially I was using this medication twice a week and had very quick positive results.  I have since cut the dose in half, and am down to once a week, and am still maintaining improved moistness.  I did notice a substantial and quick weight gain when I first began using this ... about 8 pounds ... however, after about a month the weight came back off.  That was my only side effect really.

column1: Other
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I gave a lower rating on Ease of Use because it's just plain icky.  But it has worked for my painful intercourse; I'm less apprehensive about having sex, and my husband is reassured that he isn't hurting me.  I'm only taking 0.5g once a week because of breast tenderness and vaginal discharge, and I'm still a bit tender during sex, so I'm going to continue with the dosage until the pain completely stops.  I've had some dizziness issues, but not bad.  I also think I'm retaining some water - got that "bloated" feeling.  But all in all, I'm satisfied and will continue the medication.
